definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Yet without mistakes, we could not learn or grow.。
sentences.chinese: 然而沒有錯誤，我們就不能得到新知，不能學會成長。

sentences.english: No one knows everything, but everyone can learn something. - Sean Gregory Derrick.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人無所不知，但任何人都可以學到新知。

sentences.english: The studies on human dental stem cells have been greatly progressed during recent five years.
sentences.chinese: 近五年來，牙齒幹細胞新知一日千里。

sentences.english: Students must rely on their own intelligence to learn and to explore.
sentences.chinese: 學生們必須依靠自己的聰明才智去學習和探索新知。

definition: Joint Publishing, bookstore chain and publisher, founded in Hong Kong in 1948
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
appreciation of the finer things in life
to search for sth/to seek/to quest/to explore
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
